items.title: Live: Will Nifty Smash A New Record This Friday The 13th? HCL Tech, Patanjali In Focus| Opening Bell
items.description:
Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty surged over 1.5% in the fag end of September 12 session to touch an all-time high of 83,116 and 25,433, respectively, tracking strong global cues. All sectors popped in green, with auto, metal, and energy stocks leading majority of the gains. The optimism came on the back of soft US inflation print, which was at a 3-year low of 2.5 percent in August, clearing the way for Federal Reserve to start its rate easing cycle from next week. Swap markets are pricing in about 85 percent change of a 25 basis point rate cut in the September 18 meeting, significantly up from 60 percent a week ago, showed CME-FedWatch tool. This morning global cues are mixed with Wall Street clocking a 4th straight day of gains and Asian markets edging lower in early trade. The GIFT Nifty is hinting at a positive start for our markets. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Shibani Kurian- Head - Equity Research and Fund Manager, Kotak Mahindra AMC.
 #sharemarket   #stockmarket #marketopening

items.title: Tata Motors sees mutual funds pick up shares worth Rs 12,000 crore in August
items.description: The MFs bought around 11 crore shares of the automaker in August after selling approximately 1.6 crore shares in July. Out of 37 mutual funds that have invested in Tata Motors, 32 increased their holdings in August, while five chose to dilute part of their stakes.

items.title: Muthoot Finance, Manappuram Finance shine 5% as gold prices hit record highs
items.description: The rise in gold prices benefits gold financiers by increasing the value of the collateral, thereby reducing default risk. As the collateral appreciates, it becomes more valuable compared to the loan amount issued against it, providing added security.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex Take A Pause But Midcap Index Hits Fresh High| Bajaj Twins In Focus| Closing Bell
items.description:
Nifty, Sensex take a pause but end off day's low. Midcap index hits fresh high; smallcaps upbeat. India VIX cools over 4%; breadth positive. NSE advane-decline ratio at 2:1. IT, metal, PSU banks, realty stocks shine; FMCG drags. Nifty gainers: Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd, Axis Bank. Nifty losers: SBI Life, Adani Ports, HDFC Life, ITC, Coal India, NTPC, ONGC. Nifty 500 gainers: Jubilant Pharmova, Godfrey, IDBI Bank, Home First, Linde India . Nifty 500 losers: Narayana Health, Aegis, BLS Intl, Zomato, Patanjali Foods. Join Nandita Khemka as she chats with Jay Thakkar, Head Derivatives and Quant Research, ICICI Securities for more insights!
#stockmarket, #sharemarket #nifty #sensex #marketclosing
